text: This manual is a guide to help you manage and control the SIF-400 system manually using the HMI panel on each station.
The main objective is to guide the user through the different processes of each station and, in case of error, to recover the system satisfactorily.
We recommended that you carefully read and follow each of the steps set out in the different sections in order to use the system correctly.
The document consists of two main sections:
• The main actions to be performed in all stations when working with the SIF-400
• Section describing the operation of each SIF-4XX station. Each of the station’s
In order to make it easier to read, we recommend that you follow this document in digital format
For further information on operating the station in integrated mode, refer to the Operation Manual – Integrated Mode

text: 1.1 Switching on and starting up the station
Turn on the lockable main switch located on the first station, on the Energy Data Receiver (EDR) cabinet, by placing it in position I.
Before turning on the main switch, check that the switch at each station is in position 0, otherwise a current spike may occur which will trip the facility’s circuit breaker switch
Turn on each station using the 0/I switch on the front panel. To power-up the station, turn the switch to position I.
Check that the emergency stop push button is not engaged. If it is, follow the steps in Resetting the station
Check that the manual valve of the filtering unit is in SUPPLY mode and that the station is pressured.
Proceed as indicated above, following the steps in reverse order:
1. Put the manual valve of the filtering unit in EXHAUST mode and check that the
station is not pressured. 2. Turn off each station using the 0/I switch on the front panel. To power-down the
station, turn the switch to position 0. 3. Turn off the lockable main switch located on the first station, on the Energy Data
Receiver (EDR) cabinet, by placing it in position 0.

heading_path: 1.2 Emergency stop

heading_chain: 1.2 Emergency stop
heading_path: 1.2 Emergency stop

text: In the event of an unexpected situation, the user must press the Emergency Stop button and the system will immediately stop safely.
For information, to tell the user about the current situation, the HMI panel will display the message “Emergency status” as shown in the image below.
To make the station operational after an emergency stop, follow the steps in Resetting the station

heading_chain: 1.3 Resetting the station
heading_path: 1.3 Resetting the station

heading_chain: 1.3 Resetting the station
heading_path: 1.3 Resetting the station

text: If the station has an error or no starting conditions, a "Reset Cycle" must be carried out for it to run correctly.
The steps to be followed are:
1. Press the emergency stop push button
The HMI screen will display a message in red indicating “Emergency status"
2. Release the emergency stop push button
The Emergency Stop push button will start flashing and the HMI will display a message in green indicating “X2X Bus Module status OK”

heading_chain: The RESET button will display the title in blue indicating that it can be pressed to start the “Reset Cycle”
3. Press the RESET button on the HMI screen
heading_path: The RESET button will display the title in blue indicating that it can be pressed to start the “Reset Cycle” > 3. Press the RESET button on the HMI screen

text: The RESET button will display the title in blue indicating that it can be pressed to start the “Reset Cycle”
3. Press the RESET button on the HMI screen
After pressing the button, the red message will be replaced by a yellow message with information about the reset process
Once the process has finished, the yellow message will be replaced by a green message indicating “Station is ready to run”

text: On the main panel of each HMI there is a common button panel that allows the management of the production of each station.
This control unit consists of three buttons and an alarm light.
The mode of operation is described below:
If the START button is active, it will show a green light in the title indicating that the station is in operation. To stop production, press the STOP button.
If the STOP button is active, it will show a red light in the title indicating that the station is stopped. To resume production, press the START button.

text: When the station goes into failure mode, the alarm light comes on and a status message is displayed in the lower alert table.
To exit this state there are different modes, the steps to be taken will be indicated in the message in the alert table. The most common action is to press the RESET button to recover the station.
If the RESET button is active, a flashing blue light will be displayed in the title. Press the button to exit this state and recover the station.
Unless the RESET button is active with the title flashing blue, pressing the button will have no effect
If the station goes into error mode during production, the operator should go to the HMI panel and, if indicated there, press the reset button to continue production.

text: 1.5 Remote control of the HMI panel
The HMI panel integrated into each station has dual functions: to operate the station and to display different variables and messages related to the status of the station.

The user can interact with the station by operating it directly, pressing the buttons on the HMI panel. The SIF-400 system also offers the option of connecting to the HMI panel remotely through a mobile device, using the integrated web server.
To do this, we recommended that you follow this procedure:
1. Connect to the SIF-400 Wi-Fi network
Go to the list of Wi-Fi networks on your mobile device, select the WLAN_SIF400 network and enter the password "1234567890".
If your mobile device has a built-in QR code reader, the QR code below allows you to connect to the network by simply scanning it:
2. Disable access to other wireless networks
In order for the HMI panel web server to be accessed correctly, the mobile device from which the connection is to be established must not have access to the internet.
Therefore, the mobile device must have mobile data deactivated or, failing that, airplane mode activated.
It is important to carry out this step, otherwise the mobile device will not be able to establish the connection with the HMI
3. Connect to the HMI panel of the desired station
Open any browser and enter the following URL: 130.130.130.XXX:8080, where XXX is the address for each station. The table below specifies the IP address of each station:
If the mobile device has an integrated QR code reader, the following QR codes allow you to connect directly to the various stations, without having to enter the URL manually:

text: 4. Enter your credentials and access the HMI panel
Once you have opened the browser and entered the appropriate IP address, a login page will appear.
Enter the password “admin” and press OK.
The connection will be established and a new screen will be displayed which mirrors the main display of the station’s HMI panel.
To learn more about the operation of each station, go to the Station Operation section of the appropriate station.

heading_chain: 1.6 Manual mode & integrated mode
heading_path: 1.6 Manual mode & integrated mode

heading_chain: 1.6 Manual mode & integrated mode
heading_path: 1.6 Manual mode & integrated mode

text: The SIF-400 system has two operating modes:
• Manual mode: the stations are operated individually outside the SIFMES-400
software. • Integrated mode: the stations receive orders from the SIFMES-400 software and
To configure the stations in one mode or another, at the bottom of each HMI there are two icons with the SIF400 logo.
• Manual mode: to operate in this mode, press the SIF400 logo image located at the
bottom left of the screen until the same icon appears on the opposite side.
• Integrated mode: to operate in this mode, press the SIF400 logo image at the
bottom left of the screen until a computer icon appears on the opposite side.
Alternatively, you can change modes using the SIFMES-400 software by accessing "System Status" from the "Movement" menu.
If the integrated mode is active, no manual action is possible
For further information on how to use integrated mode see Operation Manual - Integrated Mode

heading_chain: 1.7 Quality management
heading_path: 1.7 Quality management

heading_chain: 1.7 Quality management
heading_path: 1.7 Quality management

text: The SIF-400 system has five stations which can assess the production quality:
• SIF-401: a fibre optic sensor checks whether the container picked up by the
electrical axis matches the one ordered by the customer, i.e. whether it is round or square.
If an error occurs in manual mode, the HMI panel will display a pop-up information window indicating that the container collected does not correspond to the one ordered by the customer
• SIF-402: a height measurement system checks that the quantity of pellets deposited
in the container matches the order placed by the customer.
• SIF-403: an ultrasound sensor checks that the amount of liquid, water or oil, poured
into the container matches the order placed by the customer. • SIF-405: a vision camera checks that the lid that has been placed on the container
is correctly inserted using a shape algorithm.
• SIF-407: a vision camera checks that the QR label is correctly positioned and then
performs a reading to verify that its contents are legible.
Quality management in MANUAL MODE for these stations is as follows:
• Good quality: the product will leave position 2 and be sent to the next station as
indicated by the red arrow in the image below.

text: • Poor quality: the product will leave position 2 and be sent to position 5 (buffer) as
indicated by the red arrow in the image below.
Quality management in INTEGRATED MODE for the stations mentioned above is carried out by means of a screen designed for this purpose as shown below.
In manual mode, no information will be displayed and no operation will be possible on this screen
For further information on how to carry out quality management in integrated mode, refer to Operation Manual - Integrated Mode

text: The HMI panel has a screen that allows the SIFMES-400 software to be informed that a planned stop is being carried out.
Planned stops have an impact on the OEE, allowing the productivity of the station to be measured.
A planned stop can be performed for three reasons:
1. “Raw material changeover”: change of raw material (MANUAL / INTEGRATED).
3. “Preventive maintenance for component repair”: repair of a component for
The PLAY button is only active when the station is in standby mode and displaying the message “Station is ready to run” on the main HMI panel
To initiate a planned stop the operator must press the PLAY button and the counter will start indicating the time elapsed.

heading_chain: If the planned stop is in progress, the station will go into alarm mode and a message will be shown on the main display indicating the task being carried out.
heading_path: If the planned stop is in progress, the station will go into alarm mode and a message will be shown on the main display indicating the task being carried out.
image_metadata_name: SIF400_If the planned stop is in progress, the station will go into alarm mode and a message will be shown on the main display indicating the task being carried out._image_1

heading_chain: To stop the task in progress, the operator must press the STOP button.
heading_path: To stop the task in progress, the operator must press the STOP button.
image_metadata_name: SIF400_To stop the task in progress, the operator must press the STOP button._image_1

text: If the planned stop is in progress, the station will go into alarm mode and a message will be shown on the main display indicating the task being carried out.
To stop the task in progress, the operator must press the STOP button.
Once the planned task has been completed, the operator must press the “RESET" button on the main display of the HMI panel to return to normal operation as indicated in the message.
The effect of planned stops is reflected in production and can be analysed in depth using the integrated mode
For further information on how to manage planned stops in integrated mode, see Operation Manual - Integrated Mode
The maintenance of the SIF-400 system is managed by the SIFMES-400 software, which determines the useful life of each station component.
• Component #1: forward conveyor motor in double line stations, “Transfer engine
- double line forward”. • Component #2: backward conveyor motor in double line stations, “Transfer engine
• Component #3: conveyor motor in single line stations, “Transfer engine - single
• Component #4: pneumatic cylinder that holds the pallet in the operating position
at the production stations, "A Pneumatic cylinder - pallet stopper".
• Component #5: rotary table electrical actuator that picks up and ejects the pallet,
The following table shows which components each station monitors.
Station Comp#1 Comp#2 Comp#3 Comp#4 Comp#5

text: Regardless of whether the station is in manual or integrated mode, maintenance management will depend on whether the module is active in the SIFMES-400 software.
If the maintenance module is active, this means that the components could break in the middle of a production run and prevent the cycle from being completed.
If this happens, the station will enter an error mode and display a message indicating which component or components have broken and need to be repaired.
In order to continue with the production it will be necessary to repair this component from the SIFMES-400 software.
For further information on how the maintenance module in the SIFMES-400 software works, see SIFMES-400 Software Manual

heading_chain: 3.2 Station operation
heading_path: 3.2 Station operation

text: At this station, the containers are filled with solid raw material (pellets or granules).
The raw material can be of three different colours (red, blue and yellow) and can be supplied independently or mixed, in different doses.
Once the containers are filled, the amount of material introduced into the container is checked.
This mode consists of manually feeding the containers (round or square) with solid pellets (blue, yellow and red) in different quantities.
Below is the main screen of the HMI panel:
The SIF-402 station has two different operating modes, manual mode and integrated mode. To operate in integrated mode, you will need to run the SIFMES-400 operation software.
For further information on how to use integrated mode see Operation Manual - Integrated Mode

text: To operate in manual mode, follow the recommended procedure below.
Configuring the station in manual mode
Configure the station to work in manual mode from the main screen of the HMI panel.
For further information on how to set up the station in manual mode, refer to Manual mode & integrated mode
Checking the availability of raw materials
Go to the configuration screen “Station Configuration” and verify that the station correctly detects the type of hopper inserted in each position, as well as the presence of pellets.
Below is an illustration of the different messages that can be displayed:
1. “Hopper presence": the hopper is detected correctly.

text: 3. “Min level of pellet": no pellets present.
4. “No hopper unit”: there is no hopper detected.
If the configuration screen shows messages 3 or 4, position the hopper correctly and fill with the appropriate pellets.
To manually set the hopper to the desired colour, follow the steps below:
1. Click the button “Configure” for the hopper you want to set up.
2. From the pop-up screen, choose the colour of pellets contained in the hopper by
clicking one of the three buttons.
Planned stops due to changing raw materials or tools affect the OEE. To record them, follow the instructions in Planned stops

2. Select colour(s): select the required colour(s).

text: Alarms that allow production to continue (yellow message):
1. "Missing hopper 1..3”: the hopper indicated is not detected at the station. To
continue, put the hopper in place and verify that it’s been detected on the "Station Configuration" screen of the HMI panel. To finish, press the RESET button on the main screen of the HMI panel.
2. “Please refill blue / yellow / red pellets”: the product cannot be produced
because there are not enough pellets of the colour indicated. To continue, fill the corresponding hopper with pellets. To finish, press the RESET button on the main screen of the HMI panel.

text: Alarms that do not allow production to continue (red message):
1. Electrical axis failure: electrical axis failure at the station. The steps to follow are
shown in the message itself. If the failure is critical, you will need to turn the station off and on again.
2. Emergency stops: these are non-production alarms that prevent the system from
operating correctly. For example, pressing the Emergency Stop button.

heading_chain: 3.3 Power consumption
heading_path: 3.3 Power consumption

text: To recover the station from an emergency stop, refer to Reset the station

The SIF-400 system is capable of independently measuring the energy consumption of the stations in operation. The power consumption is measured individually for each station and the air consumption is measured for the entire system.
To display the power consumption data of the SIF-402 station, access the following screen:
By pressing the red PLAY button, you can make a partial measurement of the energy or air consumption in a given interval, allowing the consumption to be measured from that moment.
The air consumption of the SIF-400 system will only be shown on the HMI display of the station containing the EDR cabinet
The system displays different types of message at the bottom of the main display of the HMI panel depending on the status of the station.
The following shows the different types of messages for the SIF-402 station in both manual and integrated mode:
Station is ready to run Station is ready to start cycle
X2X Bus Module status OK Actuators and sensors have power
Please reset station Station is waiting to be reset
Station is resetting Step 0 Apply initial conditions
Station is resetting Step 1 Power signal to electrical actuators
Station is resetting Step 2 Send electrical actuators to the start position
Station is resetting Step 3 Electrical actuators in start position
Station is resetting Step 4 Check initial conditions
Please refill blue pellets Blue pellet hopper is empty
Please refill yellow pellets Yellow pellet hopper is empty
Please refill red pellets Red pellet hopper is empty
Install hopper with blue pellets No hopper installed with blue pellets
Install hopper with yellow pellets No hopper installed with yellow pellets
Install hopper with red pellets No hopper installed with red pellets
Please check product quality Check product quality
Planned maintenance stop for repair of component #1..5 Finish the planned stop and then reset the station! Station is waiting to be reset
Planned Stop, performing preventive maintenance Planned stop for maintenance
Planned Stop, performing a tool change Planned stop for tool change
Planned Stop, changing raw material Planned stop for new raw material
Emergency status Emergency Stop button pressed by user Remote I/O not in function No connection to the remote I/O unit
Please reset station No initial conditions
JXC918 Table error, please RESET the station Electrical axis error, reset station
JXC918 Table error, please POWER OFF the station Electrical axis error, restart station
JXC918 Rotary error, please RESET the station Electrical axis error, reset station
JXC918 Rotary error, please POWER OFF the station Electrical axis error, restart station
JXC918 Linear error, please RESET the station Electrical axis error, reset station
JXC918 Linear error, please POWER OFF the station Electrical axis error, restart station
Component#1..5 is broken, please repair it
Unplanned stop due to component failure 1..5
